Model

Class Bank

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Bank

  • public class Bank
extends java.lang.Object
    Class handling the bank values and transactions for a master Game object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bank(int nPlayers)
      Constructor for a Bank object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bank

        public Bank(int nPlayers)
        Constructor for a Bank object. The bank always starts with 2500 as its dValue attribute multiplied by the number of players in the Game.
        Parameters:
        nPlayers - Integer that holds the number of players in the Game.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public double getValue()
        Getter method for the dValue attribute of this class.
        Returns:
        dValue Double-precision floating point number that holds the current amount of money in the Bank object.

      • addOrDeduct

        public void addOrDeduct(double toAdd)
        Equivalent setter method for the dValue attribute of this class. Instead of changing the entire value, a certain amount is either added or deducted to the bank value.
        Parameters:
        toAdd - Double-precision floating point number that is to be added to the dValue attribute of a Bank object. The caller of this function sets this parameter negative for value deduction.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overriden toString() method from the Object class. Used only in console testing for updates on the dValue attribute of a Bank object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the dValue attribute of this class.
        See Also:
        Object.toString()
